#define BLOCK_PREFETCH_COPY   infinity

Definition at line 387 of file common_afx.cpp.

#define CACHEBLOCK   80h

# of 64-byte blocks (cache lines) for block prefetch For the largest size blocks, a special technique called Block Prefetch can be used to accelerate the read operations. Block Prefetch reads one address per cache line, for a series of cache lines, in a short loop. This is faster than using software prefetch. The technique is great for getting maximum read bandwidth, especially in DDR memory systems.

Definition at line 395 of file common_afx.cpp.

#define IN_CACHE_COPY   64 * 1024

upper limit for movq/movq copy w/SW prefetch Next is a copy that uses the MMX registers to copy 8 bytes at a time, also using the "unrolled loop" optimization. This code uses the software prefetch instruction to get the data into the cache.

Definition at line 376 of file common_afx.cpp.

Definition at line 10 of file common_afx.cpp.

#define TINY_BLOCK_COPY   64

fast memory copy

upper limit for movsd type copy The smallest copy uses the X86 "movsd" instruction, in an optimized form which is an "unrolled loop".

Definition at line 370 of file common_afx.cpp.

#define UNCACHED_COPY   197 * 1024

upper limit for movq/movntq w/SW prefetch For larger blocks, which will spill beyond the cache, it's faster to use the Streaming Store instruction MOVNTQ. This write instruction bypasses the cache and writes straight to main memory. This code also uses the software prefetch instruction to pre-read the data. USE 64 * 1024 FOR THIS VALUE IF YOU'RE ALWAYS FILLING A "CLEAN CACHE"

Definition at line 384 of file common_afx.cpp.

Definition at line 626 of file common_afx.cpp.

void* TempAlloc ( unsigned int  size  ) 

temporary memory allocation

allocates memory from a temporary pool if possible. If the pool is already in use, this function returns memory allocated on the heap. The memory returned by this function is guaranteed to be aligned to a 16-byte boundary.

could we gain ownership over the temporary memory? If so, simply return it.

Definition at line 355 of file common_afx.cpp.

void VSPrintF ( tstring &  out,
const char *  fmt,
va_list  marker 
)

exceptions disabled!

utility functions.

global functions

mingw and glibc<2.1 return -1 when the string doesn't fit so we have to try again with a bigger buffer

c99/glibc>=2.1 return the actual size of the final string whether it fits or not, so we can just use that directly

otherwise, string fit so we are done
